Module App_utils
Package App_utils.printer

Class MenuEntry<T>

java.lang.Object
App_utils.printer.MenuEntry<T>
public class MenuEntry<T> extends Object
Representation of a Menu entry, this class work together with Menu class, for building console Menu's. Menu class contains --> MenuEntry entities.

  • Field Details

    • prompt

      private String prompt
      Message that will be printed to the user.

    • observedObject

      private T observedObject
      Object this menuEntry represents

    • observerFunction

      private Predicate<T> observerFunction
      Custom Predicate to tell the Menu class if this entry must be shown or not. If null, this menuEntry will always be show.

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuEntry

      public MenuEntry(T observedObject)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      observedObject - Object this menuEntry represents.

    • MenuEntry

      public MenuEntry(T observedObject, Function<T,String> prompter)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      observedObject - Object this menuEntry represents.
      prompter - Custom Function to set the Entry prompt. Especially useful, for complex objects where its necessary to print just an specific values. ¿How it works? this function receives the observedObject and can build a custom prompt with the object attributes. Its up to your imagination.

    • MenuEntry

      public MenuEntry(T observedObject, Function<T,String> prompter, Predicate<T> canShowFunction)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      observedObject - Object this menuEntry represents.
      prompter - Custom Function to set the Entry prompt. Especially useful, for complex objects where its necessary to print just an specific values. ¿How it works? this function receives the observedObject and can build a custom prompt with the object attributes. Its up to your imagination.
      canShowFunction - Custom Predicate to tell the Menu if this Entry must be shown or not.

    • MenuEntry

      public MenuEntry(String prompt, T observedObject, Predicate<T> canShowFunction)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      prompt - Message that will be show to the user.
      observedObject - Object this menuEntry represents.
      canShowFunction - Custom Predicate to tell the Menu if this Entry must be shown or not.

  • Method Details

    • canShow

      public boolean canShow()
      Returns:
      true if the Entry can be show or not.
